I lowered the resolution and got the game to work, no more freeze at black screen. 
1440x900 worked, 1680x1050 did NOT work. 

Now I'm gonna spend some time actually trying the game! However I doubt I will buy it because of the sloppy coding with the resolution. Lots of people use desktop resolutions higher than 1440x900 today, a problem like this should pass the testing phase.

"Does any of these work I download it and try to run it and it says missing no found d3dx9_43.dll any help would be great please .I really like to play this game."

I used to have the same problem before, I have DirectX11 u see n this dll is DirectX9.

So ppl suggest u update ur directX 
I do it here http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&id=35

However this never fixed my problem. So wat I did was downloaded d3dx9_43.dll off off google and copy pasted it in the windows program folder...works like a charm. I'm assuming this isn't the right way to do it but hey... It works!! :p GL

@soupucia: There are basically 2 kinds of 24" monitors. 
Home = 16:9 1920x1080 
Professional = 16:10 1920x1200 
There are certainly more Home ones but I wouldn't say Pro is "unusual", at least not in a way that developers should ignore it.

The game starts allright for me and I've played about halfway in one session. Unfortunetely the games progress isnt saved once you quit the game. I've tried it several times but whenever I restart the game I'm back to the first level and cannot load any previously completed chapters.
